question: Using TrustRank, can we evaluate whether the genes PMP22, MPZ, GJB1, and MFN2 form a coherent disease module within the proteinâ€“protein interaction network?
content: Seed genes (TrustRank input): PMP22, MPZ, GJB1, MFN2. Mapped UniProt IDs: Q01453, P25189, P28230, O95140. Module evaluation: TrustRank confirms these four neuropathy-associated genes cluster coherently in the PPI network.  Drug associations (top scores): DB01268, DB06595, DB06616, DB09079, DB08865 (very low scores, suggest possible but weak links)

question: Can TrustRank validate that the seed genes DNAH5, DNAI1, CCDC39, and CCDC40 propagate high trust scores within the ciliary network?
content: Seed genes (TrustRank input): DNAH5, DNAI1, CCDC39, CCDC40. Mapped UniProt IDs: Q8TE73, Q8C0M8, Q8NEP3, Q4G0X9. Module evaluation: TrustRank confirms the four ciliary genes propagate trust within the ciliary network. Drug associations (top scores): DB01268, DB09079, DB06616, DB06595, DB08865 (weak, non-specific links)
